did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Bessie Jennings conducted historical tours of Westport for second grade students beginning in 1959. After her death in 1972, the tours were continued by the Westport Historical Society and the Westport Young Women's league. Trail markers were erected and a "Jennings Trail" guide map was produced.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Westport Historical Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], , [Box no]., Westport Historical Society

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Bessie Cornelia Jennings, 0B6/15/1895-10/04/1972, was a descendant of an early Greens' Farms family. She taught history from 1929 to 1958 in the Fairfield schools. she helped her father, George Penfield Jennings, prepare Greens'Farms, Connecticut, published in 1933.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection is contained in one box and measures three linear inches. Materials pertain to obtaining and erecting trail markers and also include news articles and scripts used to conduct the tours. Three copies of the "Jennings Trail' video, used as an introduction to the school tours, are stored in the Historical Society vault.
